comment: Dr. Alexander is one of my favorite professors I have ever had at KSU. He makes the difficult class easy to understand, but definitely read the textbook to solidify the information. If you go into each lecture having read the material already covered, I do not see why you would struggle to get a B or an A. Stay ahead of things and you will succeed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: This is copy pasted from the teacher evaluation I did for ways he can improve: Be on time, follow syllabus, be open about expectations on grades (not a vague rubric for lab reports, everyone got a C). Give more time to write lab notebooks during lab by lecturing less. Answer emails in a timely manner. Use D2L. Give grades back before drop date.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Definitely not the best professor at KSU. If there are other proffers, I would definitely consider them. Organic 1 is hard since there are lots of new concepts to learn and understand. He goes slow at first and speeds up really fast at the end. If you learn from the textbook well, then take him. If you don't, then it will be really difficult.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Best prof at KSU. Highly recommend especially if you need accommodations. Hes more than willing to work with you on this and will remember you even with hundreds of other students. I forgot about my own accommodations this semester, but he remembered & emailed me to remind me to get them in order, despite having other students/classes and a lab.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: By nature he is very slow with notes and pace of the class. For organic 1 it is not too bad, but organic 2 was pretty bad since he started racing through very hard/tedious material. So yeah, for orgo 1 he's pretty much a B/C with "some" effort and not much stress, but orgo 2 is B/C but with lots of effort and stress.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He is somewhat lazy, takes about a month to return quizzes and tests. Attend lecture because he places bonus questions in the notes. Follow the book and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Really great organic professor! I made an A overall by studying from the book, going to office hours and attending SI sessions! Online homework, 5-7 quizzes (2 dropped), 3 lecture tests and a cumulative final.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: In lab, he's SUPER easy, 100% take him. In lecture though, if you just try to go off of his notes, you'll struggle. If you follow the book to the t, then the class becomes very straightforward and kinda easy actually. I never got below an 80 on his exams, and got an A on one of them. If anyone says he's hard, it's because they never used the book.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: BEST organic professor! Of course this class is hard but he is very helpful in office hours. Read the book and do LOTS of practice problems, attend SI sessions for extra help, and you are very likely to make an A. 3 tests, 5-7 quizzes (2 dropped), online homework, and cumulative final (replaces lowest test). He's good for lab too, very helpful.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Alexander is a great professor and teaches things clearly. Organic Chem is a hard subject and requires a lot of work on your own part. When it comes to subjects like this it is important to know that the teacher can only do so much. Dr. Alexander is open to answering questions and will help you to figure out what ever problems you have.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Great professor took him for lab and lecture! His tests are straightforward and does not try to trick you on tests. Read the book and do practice problems and you can make an A with diligent work. He is very helpful in office hours! 5-7 quizzes (2 dropped), 3 tests and a final (final can replace lowest test grade), a lot of online homework.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: organic chem is a very difficult course but dr. alexander does everything in his power to help you. I failed gen chem 1 & 2 so I was terrified of this course but alexander is so helpful, especially during office hours. DEFINITELY go to office hours if you struggle. quizzes and tests are straightforward, no tricks, just study. hw is online, not bad
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Great lectures that cut around unnecessary information. Exams were mostly easy but he would occasionally put random questions that were passed over quickly in lecture so watch out for detail. Would recommend, especially for summer semester.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I go to UGA and this class was easier than any science class I have taken at UGA. I got a D in OCHEM 1 at UGA and came to KSU to take it and it was so much easier. I literally studied the night before the exams and would make A's. He drops two lowest quiz grades and replaces lowest test with the final. He reuses questions and doesn't use trick q's.
rating_tags: LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Alexander made organic chemistry make sense. He works examples during lecture and posts all his notes to d2l. He is also available outside of class and can answer any questions. Tests are 70% multiple choice 30% free response and are very fair. I heavily used the "Organic Chemistry as a Second Language" handbook and found it incredibly useful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Good professor. You must read and do practice problems in order to do well .
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Alexander is a very caring guy, and he is accessible and always willing to help. A lot online homework that's due the day before the test. Best way to study is through textbook. His exams are multiple choice and free response, but they weren't as challenging, in my opinion, as I would have expected. Quizzes once in a while similar to tests.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: If you want to pass this class, get a book called "Organic Chemistry as a Second Language: First Semester Topics". The textbook is awful, but this book helped me easily get a B. Alexander himself is super sweet and although quiet, he knows his stuff. Study, go to office hours, and read that book! He's one of my favorite professors at KSU.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Hard class no matter what, read the text, do his homework, you'll do fine
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Alexander is a very kind and caring teacher. His lectures are him teaching and drawing on the board, and like someone mentioned before, he is very fair with the topics on exams. His lectures may not make sense 100% of the time, so you may need to consult the text at times.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: To the person who said there was stuff on the practice test that they never saw before, Dr. Alexander specifically said "Anything on the practice exam not done in class will NOT be on the exam". And he never said we'll be tested over stuff not covered in class. He's very fair about exams, and he usually copies questions from practice exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: He doesn't teach. He literally goes up to the board and just draws. "You will be tested on material not presented in class." Our first practice test has things I've never seen and I've taken this class with another professor previously. Avoid if possible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Prof. Alexander has an unorthodox teaching style that myself and most peers were not used too. He lectures and writes/ draws everything out by hand on a projector. No power points are used through out the semester. However that being said he does his best to explain the concepts. His tests them self are fairly easy but he will look for any mistakes
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: I had to retake this class because i wasn't taking it seriously. And i had him the first time, But I knew to take him again because he is the very best to ever do it. Dr. Alexander is one of KSU's finest professors. He's incredibly smart but doesn't put too much on his students. But you do have to WORK! It's Organic Chem. STUDY and go to his office
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I was worried about how hard O-Chem would be. If you stick to the textbook and do book notes, you'll get an A. His lectures are very thorough and he's very approachable. So, don't be afraid to ask questions. If you want to go at your own pace, though, I recommend you take book notes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Get ready to cram towards the end of the semester. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND GETTING CLUTCH PREP FOR THIS CLASS (that's what saved my grade). Read the book and do practice problems! Try to practice every night because it gets progressively harder. Try to stay ahead! DO THE PRACTICE EXAMS ONLINE AND THE HANDOUTS!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Orgo is difficult. Dr. A kinda made it harder. He's nice really smart and knows his stuff but isn't good at teaching it to students. You're better off if you like or already understand orgo. I went to class to not fall behind but I taught myself everything. We still got behind and he rushed through more difficult concepts. Harsh grader. Okay class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. A is one of the best professors i've had the opportunity to work with. Study the material, read the textbook, and you'll do just fine. The class isn't difficult but if you find yourself struggling at any point, just be sure to meet with him after class. He's willing to provide help to any students who ask. He's seriously amazing!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Caring

comment: Dr. A is one of Kennesaw's best. O chem is difficult. Study. He's there for you if you need it and goes above and beyond to help you. One of the best professors in the chem. dept.

Dont go into this class thinking that it will be easy. O Chem is hard as it is, and Alexander doesnt really help much unless you ask questions or go see him during office hours. He's a nice person, but he wont help you unless you ask for it. Homework is the only thing that will save you. Study hard from the start or your will fail like I did.

I made an A, but you have to work hard as his test and quizzes are not easy. Practice the problems in the book and re-work the homework problems. He is thorough at the beginning but runs out of time and speeds up not really explaining much at the end. Overall, I would recommend him for organic 1 & 2, but you will have to work hard for a good grade

online homework, 5 quizzes (drops 2 lowest), 3 tests and a final. Replaces the lowest test with the final. This class is tough, just study his old tests and take notes and you can pull a B. I was lazy and still made a C though.

The homework is what saves your grade in this course. The tests and quizzes are pretty hard so you MUST study. Start out strong so you have room to miss a few on later exams, because the material gets exponentially harder as the semester goes on.

3 tests and a final. Straight forward teaching style. Organic is hard regardless on who you take. Toward the end he starts to run out of class time and crams everything and expects you to know everything for the acs. He expected us to teach ourselves a chapter the day before the final exam. He's thorough in the beginning but panics toward the end.

Dr. A is a hard lecture prof. This is because he doesn't do great explanation of reactions, unless you ask. He is a nice guy and funny and awesome in lab but hard in lecture. Take notes, ask questions, READ THE BOOK. I got a D FYI

My feelings about Dr. A are mixed. As a lecture professor he is very quick and doesn't give very detailed explanation of the reactions. But as a person he is very approachable and nice. For lab he is awesome. This is Ochem so it is hard, deal with it. Take notes, read the book, ask questions, PRACTICE!

Took Dr. A over the summer for lecture and lab! He so is great at explaining things in a way that makes sense. He is a very nice guy and give quizzes in lecture and lab with notice. However, the only thing is if you take him for lab, make sure your formal lab reports are ON POINT. He is very particular with them. Overall great, taking for O-Chem 2!

Would recommend him for lab. His lab feels like a lecture at times but honestly it helps a lot. Is very clear with his expectations. The quizzes are easy if you pay attention to the pre lab discussion. Very approachable overall great person to take!
Dr.Alexander is an excellent lab teacher. He can be a bit wordy with his prelab lectures sometimes but he's very approachable and helpful. Take him!

Hard content at times, but he is a GREAT professor! Very easy to ask questions and, for the most part, does an excellent job explaining the content! Would definitely recommend him for organic lab and would love to take him for lecture.

Take Dr. Alexander for O-Chem! So detailed with his answers and SUPER approachable if you have questions after class. Didn't post much extra material, rarely used the book, and didn't use D2L at all for our class, but did use Sapling for the online HW. Tests & quizzes are straightforward. He made some grading mistakes but gave points back for them.

I would recommend Dr. A for organic chem 1. He is very detailed when going over information and is VERY helpful! He posts a lot of extra info on D2L and wants you to succeed. His tests are moderately hard, however if you read and do the homework you will be fine. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
This is a challenging class but its not impossible with some studying. highly recommend. very helpful and doesnt go too fast through material.

Made an A but worked for it. READ THE BOOK, do the problems he assigns and study the material he posts. Gives you the knowledge needed to do well and tells you what to study verses being vague and wasting your time. Easiest professor for the subject, super nice, made class enjoyable. He gives practice tests and drops lowest test/quiz grades.

Dr. Alexander is nice and approachable. He moves fast in lecture and writes everything on the board. After a while I stopped trying to keep up with drawing all of the mechanisms and stuck to notes on the main points. Read the book and make your own mechanism cards from those in the text and you will do fine. Final is long but multiple choice. TAKE.

Moves very fast so be prepared to show up and take notes. Tests are 1/2 multiple choice 1/2 problem solving, very tough. Grading is good, final replaces lowest exam grade and 2 quizzes are dropped. Online homework counts as much as the final for a big grade boost. Office hrs are short but if you catch him he's helpful.
He was a very good professor. Read the book regularly and go over his old tests before every test! He will use a lot of the same questions. STudy and you'll do fine

He really isn't that hard. I made B's and A's on everything. READ THE BOOK! Test/Quizes are straight from the book! Engaging and so nice! He may not teach the best but he is the easiest for O-chem! TAKE HIM!! STUDY and you will do fine!

I loved him! Make sure you pay attention in lecture and read over the sections in the book he assigns to you. He's also very helpful if you ever need it. Quizzes aren't difficult but the tests can be tricky. Reaction equations are very important in this class so make sure you know them! I got an a high B in his class

I literally only went to half the classes. I'll admit I don't get a lot out of his lecture but all of his tests are from the book! If you read and study hard you will do fine. He gives TONS of practice and study guides and as long as you know those back and forth you will do fine. He's REALLY nice and drops 1/2 quiz grades which are also easy.

HORRIBLE PROFESSOR!!! He does not like to explain himself. Flies through the material & won't stop if anyone is confused or does not understand. You don't really know how to study for his test or quizzes. This class ATE my GPA! DO NOT TAKE him if you have an option!

I read the book every night & outlined every chapter, went to every class & took notes, I even recorded his lectures so I could go back & listen,I ALSO I went to CHEM tutoring. NONE of this helped. He is the hardest professor Ive ever taken. He teaches what's not in the book & can't slow down to explain anything to his students. AVOID AVOID AVOID!!

I had him for lab and Lecture (both semesters) and he is a great professor. Organic Chem is a hard class so you have to study, but Dr. A is willing to help all he can to help you succeed. He replaces your lowest test grade with the score on your final, which isn't very hard. I've hear he is tougher than other Organic prof's, but I liked him a lot.

3362 LAB. Took him for lab. fair professor . does talk alot so you understand what you are doing before you start lab. Grades fair. Overall Fair teacher, however takes foreeeeevvvvver to get ur graded work back
Great Great Great -

The class mainly goes by the book, although he teaches it out of order, sometimes. He is a nice guy that really wants his students to do well, if you need help go to his office hours. He sometimes gets off topic, but also introduces a lot of material that is not in the book (that will be on tests/quizzes!). He's also a hot professor!

He's a great lab professor.You have quizzes every lab, but he grades fairly and it helps you prepare for the labs. He's a fantastic person and very approachable and helpful if you go to him for help. He really wants his students to learn and succeed. I absolutely loved having him as a professor and I recommend taking him :)
Tests aren't that hard and he grades fairly. The book is pretty clear, so read it if you're having trouble. Do his homework problems! He sometimes goes off on tangents, but is a decent teacher.

He's a pretty good lab professor. The quizzes are fair and he goes over what will appear on them right before you take it. Grades leniently on lab reports, but make sure you include what he asks for. Really nice guy who will help with whatever you need. I recommend him for lab; take someone else for lecture though.

The quizzes were fairly easy. The tests were slightly misleading. Didn't really learn anything from lecture, so I went home and retaught myself. He also assigns material that he wont cover in class but will be on the test. We started slow at the beginning and ending up having to rush through the rest of the semester.

Dr. Alexander kept class interesting, he knows his material and want  everyone to learn. People got upset because he wouldn't curve the tests grades, the material is difficult and he kept it fair. KSU is not a community college so don't expect teachers to pass you just because they feel bad for you. Work hard and you can do well, would take again.
Hard DO NOT TAKE... He knows the material, but can't explain it. AVOID.
HE IS THE WORST TEACH FOR ORGANIC CHEM,HE IS NOT GOOD FOR OCHEM AT ALL,please avoid him at any cost
